result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Donald L Pulda in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  Victim notification compliance.
State's offer:  Plea to the charge in 13CF1576.  Plea to count 2 in 14CF172.  Plea to counts 1 and 2 in 14CF303.  Dismiss/read-in balance of charges, including 13CM2513 and 14CF171 in their entirety.
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of crimes and possible penalties.
Defendant stipulates to understanding.
State consents to jury waiver.
PLEA - no contest each of 4 counts
Finding and judgment of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
PSI ordered
Bond modification filed -- requesting to lift no contact with Sean Pulda, Deb Pulda and 
State takes no position.
BTC:  allowed with presence of parent; no discussion of the case.  No violent contact with all parties. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 10:00 am.
for Bond Review. Fwd to Judge.
to consolidate 13CF1576, 14CF171, 14CF172, 14CF303 and 13CM2513

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  No contact with the co-defendant except for over the telephone.  No contact with mother.  No contact with girlfriend, B.C.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

***AMENDED 5-19-2014:  DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH MOTHER BY TELEPHONE THROUGH TREATMENT PROGRAM ONLY.***

Defendant Donald L Pulda in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Donald L Pulda in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense req that matter be set for PLEAH.  Defense also requests bond mod.
State has no objection.
BTC:  Bond mod to sig bond as requested in motion.
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
ZCI
For reduction of bail.

Defendant Donald L Pulda in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer
Defense has filed bond motion as well. The State does not object to the deft continuing with program through Salvation Army. The second prong is the request to modify bond to allow contact with certain individuals. The State notes this request was previously made and the notes do not indicate if the Court has ruled on these. The State objects to bond modification citing no new information and the relationship of the deft to the persons he is requesting to have contact with.

BTC: Defendant may continue with program through Salvation Army. Bond modification is denied. Defense is to provide proof of graduation  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
ZCI
ATTY Lang Muffitt files

Defendant Donald L Pulda in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang (via speakerphone).  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Defendant is in residential treatment and is doing great.  He will need to be there the entire 6 months.
  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
